title.en: House of Prince Daohui of Qi
title.raw: 《齊悼惠王世家》 House of Prince Daohui of Qi

sentences.zh: 齊悼惠王劉肥者，高祖長庶男也。

translations.literal: King Daohui of Qi, Liu Fei, was Gaozu's eldest son by a concubine.

sentences.zh: 其母外婦也，曰曹氏。

translations.literal: His mother was a concubine surnamed Cao.

sentences.zh: 高祖六年，立肥為齊王，食七十城，諸民能齊言者皆予齊王。

translations.literal: In Gaozu year 6, he established Fei as King of Qi, ruling over seventy cities, and all people who could speak the Qi dialect were given to the King of Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In Gaozu year 6, he established Fei as King of Qi, ruling over seventy cities. All people who could speak the Qi dialect were given to the King of Qi.

translations.literal: King Daohui of Qi, Liu Fei, was Gaozu's eldest son by a concubine. His mother was an external woman named Cao Shi. In Gaozu year 6, Fei was established as King of Qi, receiving seventy cities as his domain, and all people who could speak the Qi dialect were assigned to the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王，孝惠帝兄也。

translations.literal: The King of Qi was Emperor Hui's elder brother.

sentences.zh: 孝惠帝二年，齊王入朝。

translations.literal: In Emperor Hui's second year, the King of Qi entered the capital for audience.
translations.idiomatic: In Emperor Hui's second year, the King of Qi came to court.

sentences.zh: 惠帝與齊王燕飲，亢禮如家人。

translations.literal: Emperor Hui feasted with the King of Qi, treating each other with the familiarity of family.

sentences.zh: 呂太后怒，且誅齊王。

translations.literal: Empress Lü was angry and intended to execute the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王懼不得脫，乃用其內史勳計，獻城陽郡，以為魯元公主湯沐邑。

translations.literal: The King of Qi feared he could not escape, so he used his interior minister Xun's plan, offering Chengyang commandery as a bathing fief for Princess Lu Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi feared he could not escape, so he used his interior minister Xun's plan. He offered Chengyang commandery as a bathing estate for Princess Lu Yuan.

sentences.zh: 呂太后喜，乃得辭就國。

translations.literal: Empress Lü was pleased, and thus he was able to take leave and return to his kingdom.

The King of Qi was Emperor Hui's elder brother. In Emperor Hui year 2, the King of Qi came to court. Emperor Hui feasted and drank with the King of Qi, treating him with equal ceremony like family. Empress Lü was angry and intended to execute the King of Qi. The King of Qi feared he could not escape, so he followed the plan of his interior minister Xun, offering Chengyang commandery as a bathing estate for Princess Lu Yuan. Empress Lü was pleased, and thus he was allowed to take leave and return to his state.

sentences.zh: 悼惠王即位十三年，以惠帝六年卒。

translations.literal: King Daohui reigned for thirteen years and died in Emperor Hui's sixth year.

sentences.zh: 子襄立，是為哀王。

translations.literal: His son Xiang ascended the throne, becoming King Ai.
King Daohui reigned for thirteen years and died in Emperor Hui year 6. His son Xiang ascended the throne, becoming King Ai.

sentences.zh: 哀王元年，孝惠帝崩，呂太后稱制，天下事皆決於高后。

translations.literal: In King Ai's first year, Emperor Hui passed away. Empress Lü acted as regent, and all affairs of the realm were decided by the empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 二年，高后立其兄子酈侯呂臺為呂王，割齊之濟南郡為呂王奉邑。

translations.literal: In year 2, the empress dowager established her brother's son Marquis Lü Tai of Lü as King of Lü, carving out Jinan commandery from Qi as the King of Lü's fief.
translations.idiomatic: In year 2, the empress dowager established her brother's son, Marquis Lü Tai of Lü, as King of Lü. She carved out Jinan commandery from Qi as the King of Lü's fief.

translations.literal: In King Ai year 1, Emperor Hui passed away, Empress Lü assumed regency, and all affairs of the realm were decided by the Empress Dowager. In year 2, the Empress Dowager established her brother's son Marquis Lü Tai of Zhi as King of Lü, carving off Jinan commandery from Qi as the King of Lü's support estate.

sentences.zh: 哀王三年，其弟章入宿衛於漢，呂太后封為朱虛侯，以呂祿女妻之。

translations.literal: In King Ai's third year, his younger brother Zhang entered Han's palace guard service. Empress Lü enfeoffed him as Marquis of Zhuxu and married him to Lü Lü's daughter.

sentences.zh: 後四年，封章弟興居為東牟侯，皆宿衛長安中。

translations.literal: Four years later, she enfeoffed Zhang's younger brother Xingju as Marquis of Dongmu. Both served as palace guards in Chang'an.

In King Ai year 3, his younger brother Zhang entered the palace guard in Han, and Empress Lü enfeoffed him as Marquis of Zhuxu, marrying him to Lü Lü's daughter. Four years later, she enfeoffed Zhang's younger brother Xingju as Marquis of Dongmu, both serving as guards in Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 哀王八年，高后割齊瑯邪郡立營陵侯劉澤為瑯邪王。

translations.literal: In King Ai's eighth year, the empress dowager carved out Langye commandery from Qi and established Marquis Liu Ze of Yingling as King of Langye.
In King Ai year 8, the Empress Dowager carved off Langye commandery from Qi and established Marquis Liu Ze of Yingling as King of Langye.

sentences.zh: 其明年，趙王友入朝，幽死于邸。

translations.literal: The next year, King You of Zhao came to court and died of sorrow in his residence.

sentences.zh: 三趙王皆廢。

translations.literal: All three kings of Zhao were deposed.

sentences.zh: 高后立諸呂諸呂為三王，擅權用事。

translations.literal: The empress dowager established various Lü clansmen as three kings, monopolizing power and controlling affairs.

The following year, King Zhao You came to court and died in mysterious circumstances at his residence. All three Zhao kings were deposed. The Empress Dowager established various Lü clansmen as three kings, monopolizing power and handling affairs.

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯年二十，有氣力，忿劉氏不得職。

translations.literal: Marquis Zhuxu was twenty years old, strong and vigorous, resentful that the Liu clan did not hold office.

sentences.zh: 嘗入待高后燕飲，高后令朱虛侯劉章為酒吏。

translations.literal: Once when he entered to attend the empress dowager's feast, the empress dowager commanded Marquis Zhuxu Liu Zhang to serve as wine steward.

sentences.zh: 章自請曰：「臣，將種也，請得以軍法行酒。」

translations.literal: Zhang requested himself: 'Your servant is of general's lineage. Please allow me to serve wine according to military law.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang requested, 'I am of general's lineage. Please allow me to serve wine according to military law.'

sentences.zh: 高后曰：「可。」

translations.literal: The empress dowager said: 'Very well.'
translations.idiomatic: The empress dowager said, 'Very well.'

sentences.zh: 酒酣，章進飲歌舞。

translations.literal: When the wine flowed freely, Zhang advanced to drink and performed songs and dances.

sentences.zh: 已而曰：「請為太后言耕田歌。」

translations.literal: Soon after he said: 'Please allow me to sing a farming song for the empress dowager.'
translations.idiomatic: Soon after he said, 'Please allow me to sing a farming song for the empress dowager.'

sentences.zh: 高后兒子畜之，笑曰：「顧而父知田耳。

translations.literal: The empress dowager treated him like a child and laughed: 'Only your father knows farming.
translations.idiomatic: The empress dowager treated him like a child and laughed, 'Only your father knows farming.

sentences.zh: 若生而為王子，安知田乎？」

translations.literal: If you were born as a prince's son, how would you know farming?'

sentences.zh: 章曰：「臣知之。」

translations.literal: Zhang said: 'Your servant knows it.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang said, 'I know it.'

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「試為我言田。」

translations.literal: The empress dowager said: 'Try telling me about farming.'
translations.idiomatic: The empress dowager said, 'Try telling me about farming.'

sentences.zh: 章曰：「深耕穊種，立苗欲疏，非其種者，鉏而去之。」

translations.literal: Zhang said: 'Deeply plow and carefully sow. Plant seedlings sparsely. Those that are not of our seed, hoe them out and remove them.'
translations.idiomatic: Zhang said, 'Deeply plow and carefully sow. Plant seedlings sparsely. Those that are not of our seed, hoe them out and remove them.'

sentences.zh: 呂后默然。

translations.literal: Empress Lü was silent.

sentences.zh: 頃之，諸呂有一人醉，亡酒，章追，拔劍斬之，而還報曰：「有亡酒一人，臣謹行法斬之。」

translations.literal: Soon after, one of the Lü clansmen became drunk and left during the drinking ceremony. Zhang pursued him, drew his sword, and executed him, then returned and reported: 'There was one who left during the drinking ceremony. Your servant respectfully executed military law and beheaded him.'
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, one of the Lü clansmen became drunk and left during the drinking ceremony. Zhang pursued him, drew his sword, and executed him, then returned and reported, 'There was one who left during the drinking ceremony. I respectfully executed military law and beheaded him.'

sentences.zh: 太后左右皆大驚。

translations.literal: The empress dowager's attendants on both sides were all greatly astonished.
translations.idiomatic: The empress dowager's attendants were all greatly astonished.

sentences.zh: 業已許其軍法，無以罪也。

translations.literal: She had already permitted him to use military law, so there was no way to punish him.

sentences.zh: 因罷。

translations.literal: Thus the gathering ended.

sentences.zh: 自是之後，諸呂憚朱虛侯，雖大臣皆依朱虛侯，劉氏為益彊。

translations.literal: From this time on, the various Lü feared Marquis Zhuxu. Even the ministers all relied on Marquis Zhuxu, and the Liu clan became increasingly strong.

Marquis Zhuxu was twenty years old, strong and vigorous, resentful that the Liu clan held no offices. Once he entered to attend the Empress Dowager's feast, and the Empress Dowager ordered Marquis Zhuxu Liu Zhang to serve as wine steward. Zhang requested himself: 'Your servant is of general's stock, please allow me to conduct the drinking with military law.' The Empress Dowager said: 'Very well.' When the wine flowed freely, Zhang presented drinking toasts and music and dance. Soon after he said: 'Please allow me to sing a farming song for the Empress Dowager.' The Empress Dowager regarded him as a child and laughed, saying: 'Your father only knows farming. If you were born as a prince, how would you know farming?' Zhang said: 'Your servant knows it.' The Empress Dowager said: 'Try singing farming for me.' Zhang said: 'Deep plowing and careful seeding, plant seedlings sparsely, those that are not the right seeds, hoe them out and remove them.' Empress Lü was silent. Soon after, one of the Lü clansmen got drunk and left the drinking circle. Zhang pursued him, drew his sword and beheaded him, then returned and reported: 'One person left the drinking circle, your servant has properly executed military law and beheaded him.' All those around the Empress Dowager were greatly shocked. She had already permitted military law, so there was no way to punish him. Thus the banquet ended. From this time forward, the various Lü feared Marquis Zhuxu, and even ministers all relied on Marquis Zhuxu, so the Liu clan grew stronger.

sentences.zh: 其明年，高后崩。

translations.literal: The next year, Empress Gao passed away.

sentences.zh: 趙王呂祿為上將軍，呂王產為相國，皆居長安中，聚兵以威大臣，欲為亂。

translations.literal: King Lü Lü of Zhao served as supreme general, King Lü Chan of Lü served as chancellor. Both resided in Chang'an, gathered troops to intimidate the ministers, and wished to rebel.

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯章以呂祿女為婦，知其謀，乃使人陰出告其兄齊王，欲令發兵西，朱虛侯、東牟侯為內應，以誅諸呂，因立齊王為帝。

translations.literal: Marquis Zhuxu Zhang had Lü Lü's daughter as his wife and knew their plot. He secretly sent someone to inform his elder brother the King of Qi, wishing to have him raise troops west, with Marquis Zhuxu and Marquis Dongmu as internal supporters, to execute the various Lü and thereby establish the King of Qi as emperor.

The following year, the Empress Dowager passed away. King Zhao Lü Lü served as supreme general, King Lü Lü Chan as chancellor, both residing in Chang'an, gathering troops to intimidate ministers, desiring to create disorder. Marquis Zhuxu Zhang, having Lü Lü's daughter as his wife, knew their plot, so he secretly sent someone to inform his elder brother the King of Qi, wishing him to raise troops west, with Marquis Zhuxu and Marquis Dongmu as internal support, to execute the various Lü and thereby establish the King of Qi as emperor.

sentences.zh: 齊王既聞此計，乃與其舅父駟鈞、郎中令祝午、中尉魏勃陰謀發兵。

translations.literal: The King of Qi, having heard this plan, secretly conspired with his maternal uncle Si Jun, Chamberlain for Attendants Zhu Wu, and Commander Wei Bo to raise troops.

sentences.zh: 齊相召平聞之，乃發卒衛王宮。

translations.literal: The Qi chancellor Zhao Ping heard of this and raised troops to guard the king's palace.

sentences.zh: 魏勃紿召平曰：「王欲發兵，非有漢虎符驗也。

translations.literal: Wei Bo deceived Zhao Ping saying: 'The king wishes to raise troops, but he does not have Han's tiger tally verification.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Bo deceived Zhao Ping saying, 'The king wishes to raise troops, but he does not have Han's tiger tally verification.

sentences.zh: 而相君圍王，固善。

translations.literal: For the chancellor to surround the king is indeed good.

sentences.zh: 勃請為君將兵衛衛王。」

translations.literal: I request to lead troops for you to guard the king.'

sentences.zh: 召平信之，乃使魏勃將兵圍王宮。

translations.literal: Zhao Ping believed him and had Wei Bo lead troops to surround the king's palace.

sentences.zh: 勃既將兵，使圍相府。

translations.literal: Once Wei Bo had the troops, he had them surround the chancellor's residence.

sentences.zh: 召平曰：「嗟乎！

translations.literal: Zhao Ping said: 'Alas!
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Ping said, 'Alas!

sentences.zh: 道家之言『當斷不斷，反受其亂』，乃是也。」

translations.literal: The Daoist saying 'When you should cut off, don't cut off, and you will receive chaos instead'—this is exactly it.'

sentences.zh: 遂自殺。

translations.literal: Thus he committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 於是齊王以駟鈞為相，魏勃為將軍，祝午為內史，悉發國中兵。

translations.literal: Thus the King of Qi appointed Si Jun as chancellor, Wei Bo as general, Zhu Wu as interior minister, and raised all troops in the state.

sentences.zh: 使祝午東詐瑯邪王曰：「呂氏作亂，齊王發兵欲西誅之。

translations.literal: He sent Zhu Wu east to deceive the King of Langye saying: 'The Lü clan has rebelled. The King of Qi has raised troops and wishes to go west to execute them.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Zhu Wu east to deceive the King of Langye saying, 'The Lü clan has rebelled. The King of Qi has raised troops and wishes to go west to execute them.

sentences.zh: 齊王自以兒子，年少，不習兵革之事，願舉國委大王。

translations.literal: The King of Qi considers himself young and inexperienced in military affairs, and wishes to entrust the entire state to Your Majesty.

sentences.zh: 大王自高帝將也，習戰事。

translations.literal: Your Majesty was personally a general of Gaozu and is experienced in warfare.

sentences.zh: 齊王不敢離兵，使臣請大王幸之臨菑見齊王計事，并將齊兵以西平關中之亂。」

translations.literal: The King of Qi dares not leave his troops, so he sends me to request that Your Majesty deign to come to Linzi to meet with the King of Qi and discuss affairs, and moreover lead the Qi troops west to pacify the chaos in Guanzhong.'

sentences.zh: 瑯邪王信之，以為然，（西）［迺］馳見齊王。

translations.literal: The King of Langye believed it and agreed, then galloped to see the King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王與魏勃等因留瑯邪王，而使祝午盡發瑯邪國而并將其兵。

translations.literal: The King of Qi and Wei Bo and others detained the King of Langye, and had Zhu Wu raise all troops from the Langye state and combine them with his command.

The King of Qi, having heard this plan, then secretly plotted with his maternal uncle Si Jun, Chamberlain for Attendants Zhu Wu, and Commandant Wei Bo to raise troops. The Qi chancellor Zhao Ping heard of it and dispatched troops to guard the king's palace. Wei Bo deceived Zhao Ping, saying: 'The king wishes to raise troops, but has no Han tiger tally verification. Your Lordship surrounding the king is certainly good. I request to lead troops for your Lordship to guard the king.' Zhao Ping believed him and had Wei Bo lead troops to surround the king's palace. Once Wei Bo had troops, he had them surround the chancellor's residence. Zhao Ping said: 'Alas! The Daoist saying 'when you should cut off, don't cut off, and you will suffer disorder instead'—this is indeed it.' He then committed suicide. Thus the King of Qi appointed Si Jun as chancellor, Wei Bo as general, Zhu Wu as interior minister, and mobilized all troops in the state. He sent Zhu Wu east to deceive the King of Langye, saying: 'The Lü clan is creating disorder, the King of Qi has raised troops and wishes to go west to execute them. The King of Qi considers himself still a child, young and inexperienced in military affairs, and wishes to entrust the entire state to your majesty. Your majesty was personally Gaozu's general and is experienced in warfare. The King of Qi dares not leave his troops, so he sends me to request your majesty to graciously come to Linzi to see the King of Qi and discuss affairs, and moreover lead the Qi troops west to pacify the disorder in Guanzhong.' The King of Langye believed it and considered it right, so he galloped to see the King of Qi. The King of Qi and Wei Bo and others detained the King of Langye, and sent Zhu Wu to fully mobilize the Langye state and lead its troops as well.

sentences.zh: 瑯邪王劉澤既見欺，不得反國，乃說齊王曰：「齊悼惠王高皇帝長子，推本言之，而大王高皇帝適長孫也，當立。

translations.literal: The King of Langye Liu Ze, having been deceived and unable to return to his kingdom, persuaded the King of Qi saying: 'King Daohui of Qi was Gaozu's eldest son. Tracing back to the fundamentals, Your Majesty is Gaozu's legitimate eldest grandson and should be established.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Langye Liu Ze, having been deceived and unable to return to his kingdom, persuaded the King of Qi saying, 'King Daohui of Qi was Gaozu's eldest son. Tracing back to the fundamentals, Your Majesty is Gaozu's legitimate eldest grandson and should be established.

sentences.zh: 今諸大臣狐疑未有所定，而澤於劉氏最為長年，大臣固待澤決計。

translations.literal: Now the various ministers are doubtful and have not yet decided, but Ze is the most senior among the Liu clan, and the ministers certainly await Ze's decision.

sentences.zh: 今大王留臣無為也，不如使我入關計事。」

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty detaining me serves no purpose. It would be better to send me into the passes to discuss affairs.'

sentences.zh: 齊王以為然，乃益具車送瑯邪王。

translations.literal: The King of Qi agreed and provided additional carriages to send the King of Langye.

King Langye Liu Ze, having been deceived and unable to return to his state, then advised the King of Qi: 'King Daohui of Qi was Gaozu's eldest son, tracing back to fundamentals, and your majesty is Gaozu's legitimate eldest grandson, you should be established. Now the various ministers are hesitant and undecided, but I am the oldest among the Liu clan, the ministers certainly await my decision. Now your majesty detaining me serves no purpose, it would be better to let me enter the passes to discuss affairs.' The King of Qi considered it right and provided even more carriages to send the King of Langye.

sentences.zh: 瑯邪王既行，齊遂舉兵西攻呂國之濟南。

translations.literal: Once the King of Langye had departed, Qi raised troops and attacked west toward the Lü state's Jinan.

sentences.zh: 於是齊哀王遺諸侯王書曰：「高帝平定天下，王諸子弟，悼惠王於齊。

translations.literal: Thus King Ai of Qi sent letters to the various feudal kings saying: 'Gaozu pacified the realm and enfeoffed his sons and younger brothers, with King Daohui in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Thus King Ai of Qi sent letters to the various feudal kings saying, 'Gaozu pacified the realm and enfeoffed his sons and younger brothers, with King Daohui in Qi.

sentences.zh: 悼惠王薨，惠帝使留侯張良立臣為齊王。

translations.literal: King Daohui passed away, and Emperor Hui sent Marquis Liu Zhang Liang to establish me as King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠帝崩，高后用事，春秋高，聽諸呂擅廢高帝所立，又殺三趙王，滅梁、燕、趙以王諸呂，分齊國為四。

translations.literal: Emperor Hui passed away, and the empress dowager took charge. Being advanced in years, she listened to the various Lü who arbitrarily deposed those Gaozu had established, moreover killed the three kings of Zhao, extinguished Liang, Yan, and Zhao to enfeoff the various Lü, and divided Qi into four parts.

sentences.zh: 忠臣進諫，上惑亂不聽。

translations.literal: Loyal ministers offered remonstrance, but the empress dowager was confused and would not listen.

sentences.zh: 今高后崩，皇帝春秋富，未能治天下，固恃大臣諸（將）［侯］。

translations.literal: Now the empress dowager has passed away. The emperor is young and cannot yet govern the realm, certainly relying on the ministers and marquises.

sentences.zh: 今諸呂又擅自尊官，聚兵嚴威，劫列侯忠臣，矯制以令天下，宗廟所以危。

translations.literal: Now the various Lü arbitrarily elevate their official positions, gather troops and display stern authority, coerce the marquises and loyal ministers, and falsely issue commands to govern the realm—the ancestral temples are thus endangered.

sentences.zh: 今寡人率兵入誅不當為王者。」

translations.literal: Now I lead troops to enter and execute those who should not be kings.'

Once the King of Langye had departed, Qi then raised troops west to attack the Lü state's Jinan. Thus King Ai of Qi sent letters to the various feudal kings, saying: 'Gaozu pacified the realm and enfeoffed his sons and brothers, establishing King Daohui in Qi. When King Daohui passed away, Emperor Hui sent Marquis Liu Zhang Liang to establish me as King of Qi. When Emperor Hui passed away, the Empress Dowager handled affairs, being advanced in years, listening to the various Lü arbitrarily depose those Gaozu had established, moreover killing the three Zhao kings, abolishing Liang, Yan, and Zhao to enfeoff the various Lü, dividing Qi into four parts. Loyal ministers offered remonstrance, but above was confused and would not listen. Now the Empress Dowager has passed away, the emperor is young and has not yet governed the realm, certainly relying on ministers and marquises. Now the various Lü arbitrarily elevate their officials, gather troops and display stern authority, coerce marquises and loyal ministers, falsify edicts to command the realm, thus endangering the ancestral temples. Now I lead troops to enter and execute those who should not be kings.'

sentences.zh: 漢聞齊發兵而西，相國呂產乃遣大將軍灌嬰東擊之。

translations.literal: Han heard that Qi had raised troops and gone west, so Chancellor Lü Chan sent Grand General Guan Ying east to attack them.

sentences.zh: 灌嬰至滎陽，乃謀曰：「諸呂將兵居關中，欲危劉氏而自立。

translations.literal: Guan Ying reached Xingyang and plotted saying: 'The various Lü command troops and reside in Guanzhong, wishing to endanger the Liu clan and establish themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Guan Ying reached Xingyang and plotted saying, 'The various Lü command troops and reside in Guanzhong, wishing to endanger the Liu clan and establish themselves.

sentences.zh: 我今破齊還報，是益呂氏資也。」

translations.literal: If I now defeat Qi and return to report, this will increase the Lü clan's resources.'

sentences.zh: 乃留兵屯滎陽，使使喻齊王及諸侯，與連和，以待呂氏之變而共誅之。

translations.literal: He stationed troops at Xingyang and sent envoys to explain to the King of Qi and the various feudal lords, allying with them to await the Lü clan's rebellion and jointly execute them.

sentences.zh: 齊王聞之，乃西取其故濟南郡，亦屯兵於齊西界以待約。

translations.literal: The King of Qi heard this and took back his former Jinan commandery to the west, also stationing troops on Qi's western border to await the agreement.

Han heard that Qi had raised troops and was advancing west, so Chancellor Lü Chan dispatched Grand General Guan Ying east to attack them. Guan Ying reached Xingyang and plotted, saying: 'The various Lü have troops stationed in Guanzhong, desiring to endanger the Liu clan and establish themselves. If I defeat Qi now and return to report, this will increase the Lü clan's resources.' He stationed troops at Xingyang and sent envoys to explain to the King of Qi and the various feudal lords, forming an alliance with them to await the Lü clan's rebellion and jointly execute them. The King of Qi heard this and took back his former Jinan commandery to the west, also stationing troops at Qi's western border to await the agreement.

sentences.zh: 呂祿、呂產欲作亂關中，朱虛侯與太尉勃、丞相平等誅之。

translations.literal: Lü Lü and Lü Chan wished to rebel in Guanzhong. Marquis Zhuxu together with Grand Marshal Bo and Chancellor Chen and others executed them.

sentences.zh: 朱虛侯首先斬呂產，於是太尉勃等乃得盡誅諸呂。

translations.literal: Marquis Zhuxu was the first to behead Lü Chan, and thus Grand Marshal Bo and others were able to completely execute the various Lü.

sentences.zh: 而瑯邪王亦從齊至長安。

translations.literal: The King of Langye also arrived at Chang'an from Qi.

Lü Lü and Lü Chan desired to create disorder in Guanzhong, but Marquis Zhuxu with Grand Commandant Bo and Chancellor Chen Ping and others executed them. Marquis Zhuxu first beheaded Lü Chan, thus Grand Commandant Bo and others were able to completely execute the various Lü. The King of Langye also arrived at Chang'an from Qi.

sentences.zh: 大臣議欲立齊王，而瑯邪王及大臣曰：「齊王母家駟鈞，惡戾，虎而冠者也。

translations.literal: The ministers discussed wishing to establish the King of Qi, but the King of Langye and other ministers said: 'The King of Qi's maternal family Si Jun are cruel and fierce, like tigers wearing caps.
translations.idiomatic: The ministers discussed wishing to establish the King of Qi, but the King of Langye and other ministers said, 'The King of Qi's maternal family Si Jun are cruel and fierce, like tigers wearing caps.

sentences.zh: 方以呂氏故幾亂天下，今又立齊王，是欲復為呂氏也。

translations.literal: Because of the Lü clan they nearly threw the realm into chaos. Now to establish the King of Qi would be to create another Lü clan.

sentences.zh: 代王母家薄氏，君子長者；

translations.literal: The King of Dai's maternal family the Bo clan are worthy and virtuous elders;

sentences.zh: 且代王又親高帝子，於今見在，且最為長。

translations.literal: moreover the King of Dai is personally Gaozu's son, and is presently alive, and moreover is the most senior.

sentences.zh: 以子則順，以善人則大臣安。」

translations.literal: In terms of succession it is proper, in terms of worthy people the ministers will be at peace.'

sentences.zh: 於是大臣乃謀迎立代王，而遣朱虛侯以誅呂氏事告齊王，令罷兵。

translations.literal: Thus the ministers plotted to welcome and establish the King of Dai, and sent Marquis Zhuxu to inform the King of Qi about executing the Lü clan, commanding him to disband his troops.

The ministers discussed desiring to establish the King of Qi, but the King of Langye and ministers said: 'The King of Qi's maternal family Si Jun are wicked and fierce, tigers wearing caps. Just because of the Lü clan they nearly threw the realm into chaos, now establishing the King of Qi would be desiring to repeat the Lü affair. The King of Dai's maternal family the Bo clan are gentlemen and elders; moreover the King of Dai is Gaozu's own son, currently present, and moreover the oldest. In terms of succession it is proper, in terms of good people the ministers are at peace.' Thus the ministers plotted to welcome and establish the King of Dai, sending Marquis Zhuxu to inform the King of Qi of the execution of the Lü clan and order him to disband his troops.

sentences.zh: 灌嬰在滎陽，聞魏勃本教齊王反，既誅呂氏，罷齊兵，使使召責問魏勃。

translations.literal: Guan Ying was at Xingyang. Hearing that Wei Bo had originally instructed the King of Qi to rebel, and now that the Lü clan had been executed and Qi troops disbanded, he sent envoys to summon and question Wei Bo.

sentences.zh: 勃曰：「失火之家，豈暇先言大人而後救火乎！」

translations.literal: Bo said: 'In a house where fire has broken out, how can one have time to first inform the elders before putting out the fire!'
translations.idiomatic: Bo said, 'In a house where fire has broken out, how can one have time to first inform the elders before putting out the fire!'

sentences.zh: 因退立，股戰而栗，恐不能言者，終無他語。

translations.literal: He stepped back and stood there, his legs trembling and shivering as if he could not speak, and in the end said nothing else.

sentences.zh: 灌將軍熟視笑曰：「人謂魏勃勇，妄庸人耳，何能為乎！」

translations.literal: General Guan stared at him intently and laughed: 'People say Wei Bo is brave, but he's just a cowardly mediocrity—what can he accomplish!'
translations.idiomatic: General Guan stared at him intently and laughed, 'People say Wei Bo is brave, but he's just a cowardly mediocrity—what can he accomplish!'

sentences.zh: 乃罷魏勃。

translations.literal: Thus he dismissed Wei Bo.

sentences.zh: 魏勃父以善鼓琴見秦皇帝。

translations.literal: Wei Bo's father was skilled at playing the zither and was received by the Qin emperor.

sentences.zh: 及魏勃少時，欲求見齊相曹參，家貧無以自通，乃常獨早夜埽齊相舍人門外。

translations.literal: When Wei Bo was young, he wished to seek an audience with Qi Chancellor Cao Can. Being poor with no means to gain access, he often alone swept the doorway of the chancellor's retainers from early morning to night.

sentences.zh: 相舍人怪之，以為物，而伺之，得勃。

translations.literal: The chancellor's retainers found it strange, thinking it some sort of spirit, and spied on it, discovering Bo.

sentences.zh: 勃曰：「願見相君，無因，故為子埽，欲以求見。」

translations.literal: Bo said: 'I wish to see the chancellor. Having no connections, I sweep for you in order to seek an audience.'
translations.idiomatic: Bo said, 'I wish to see the chancellor. Having no connections, I sweep for you in order to seek an audience.'

sentences.zh: 於是舍人見勃曹參，因以為舍人。

translations.literal: Thus the retainers introduced Bo to Cao Can, who made him a retainer.

sentences.zh: 一為參御，言事，參以為賢，言之齊悼惠王。

translations.literal: Once while serving Cao Can and discussing affairs, Can considered him worthy and spoke of him to King Daohui of Qi.

sentences.zh: 悼惠王召見，則拜為內史。

translations.literal: King Daohui summoned and saw him, then appointed him interior minister.

sentences.zh: 始，悼惠王得自置二千石。

translations.literal: At first, King Daohui was permitted to appoint officials of 2000 shi stipend himself.

sentences.zh: 及悼惠王卒而哀王立，勃用事，重於齊相。

translations.literal: When King Daohui died and King Ai ascended, Bo took charge of affairs and was more important than the Qi chancellor.

Guan Ying at Xingyang heard that Wei Bo had originally taught the King of Qi to rebel, and after executing the Lü clan, disbanded the Qi troops, so he sent someone to summon and question Wei Bo. Bo said: 'A house on fire—how can one take time to first inform one's elders before putting out the fire!' He retreated and stood there, his legs trembling and shaking, fearing he could not speak, but in the end had no other words. General Guan gazed at him intently and laughed, saying: 'People say Wei Bo is brave, but he's just a false mediocre person—what can he accomplish!' Thus he dismissed Wei Bo. Wei Bo's father was skilled at playing zither and was received by the Qin emperor. When Wei Bo was young, he wished to see the Qi chancellor Cao Can, but was poor with no way to introduce himself, so he often alone swept the doorway of the chancellor's retainers from morning to night. The chancellor's retainers found it strange, thinking it some creature, and spied on it, discovering Bo. Bo said: 'I wish to see the chancellor, having no means, so I swept for you, desiring to seek an audience.' Thus the retainers presented Bo to Cao Can, who took him as a retainer. Once he served as Cao Can's driver and spoke of affairs, Can considered him worthy and recommended him to King Daohui of Qi. King Daohui summoned and saw him, then appointed him as interior minister. At first, King Daohui was allowed to appoint officials of 2000 bushels himself. When King Daohui died and King Ai ascended, Bo handled affairs and was weightier than the Qi chancellor.

sentences.zh: 王既罷兵歸，而代王來立，是為孝文帝。

translations.literal: The king had already disbanded his troops and returned home, while the King of Dai came and was established, becoming Emperor Wen.
The king having disbanded his troops and returned, the King of Dai came and was established, becoming Emperor Wen.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝元年，盡以高后時所割齊之城陽、瑯邪、濟南郡復與齊，而徙瑯邪王王燕，益封朱虛侯、東牟侯各二千戶。

translations.literal: In Emperor Wen's first year, he returned all the Chengyang, Langye, and Jinan commanderies that had been taken from Qi during the empress dowager's time back to Qi, moved the King of Langye to rule Yan, and increased the enfeoffments of Marquis Zhuxu and Marquis Dongmu by 2000 households each.

In Emperor Wen year 1, all the Chengyang, Langye, and Jinan commanderies that had been carved from Qi during the Empress Dowager's time were returned to Qi, while the King of Langye was moved to rule Yan, and Marquis Zhuxu and Marquis Dongmu were each granted an additional 2000 households.

sentences.zh: 是歲，齊哀王卒，太子（側）［則］立，是為文王。

translations.literal: That year, King Ai of Qi died, and his heir Ze ascended the throne, becoming King Wen.
That year, King Ai of Qi died, the crown prince ascended the throne, becoming King Wen.

sentences.zh: 齊文王元年，漢以齊之城陽郡立朱虛侯為城陽王，以齊濟北郡立東牟侯為濟北王。

translations.literal: In King Wen of Qi's first year, Han used Qi's Chengyang commandery to establish Marquis Zhuxu as King of Chengyang, and used Qi's Jibei commandery to establish Marquis Dongmu as King of Jibei.
In King Wen of Qi year 1, Han established Marquis Zhuxu as King of Chengyang using Qi's Chengyang commandery, and established Marquis Dongmu as King of Jibei using Qi's Jibei commandery.

sentences.zh: 二年，濟北王反，漢誅殺之，地入于漢。

translations.literal: In year 2, the King of Jibei rebelled. Han executed him, and the territory reverted to Han.
In year 2, the King of Jibei rebelled, Han executed him, and the territory was incorporated into Han.

sentences.zh: 後二年，孝文帝盡封齊悼惠王子罷軍等七人皆為列侯。

translations.literal: Two years later, Emperor Wen completely enfeoffed seven sons of King Daohui of Qi including Ba Jun as marquises.
Two years later, Emperor Wen fully enfeoffed seven sons of King Daohui of Qi including Ba Jun and others as marquises.

sentences.zh: 齊文王立十四年卒，無子，國除，地入于漢。

translations.literal: King Wen of Qi reigned for fourteen years and died without sons. The state was abolished, and the territory reverted to Han.
King Wen of Qi reigned for fourteen years and died without sons, the state was abolished, and the territory incorporated into Han.

sentences.zh: 後一歲，孝文帝以所封悼惠王子分齊為王，齊孝王將閭以悼惠王子楊虛侯為齊王。

translations.literal: One year later, Emperor Wen divided Qi among the enfeoffed sons of King Daohui as kings. King Xiao of Qi Jiang Lü made Yangxu Marquis, a son of King Daohui, King of Qi.

sentences.zh: 故齊別郡盡以王悼惠王子：子志為濟北王，子辟光為濟南王，子賢為菑川王，子卬為膠西王，子雄渠為膠東王，與城陽、齊凡七王。

translations.literal: Thus the former separate commanderies of Qi were all used to enfeoff sons of King Daohui as kings: son Zhi as King of Jibei, son Pi Guang as King of Jinan, son Xian as King of Zichuan, son Ang as King of Jiaoxi, son Xiong Qu as King of Jiaodong, together with Chengyang and Qi making seven kings in all.

One year later, Emperor Wen divided the previously enfeoffed sons of King Daohui to make them kings, establishing Yangxu Marquis, son of King Daohui, as King of Qi. Thus all the separate commanderies of Qi were used to enfeoff sons of King Daohui as kings: son Zhi as King of Jibei, son Pi Guang as King of Jinan, son Xian as King of Zichuan, son Ang as King of Jiaoxi, son Xiong Qu as King of Jiaodong, together with Chengyang and Qi, making seven kings in all.

sentences.zh: 齊孝王十一年，吳王濞、楚王戊反，興兵西，告諸侯曰「將誅漢賊臣晁錯以安宗廟」。

translations.literal: In King Xiao of Qi's eleventh year, King Pi of Wu and King Wu of Chu rebelled, raised troops west, and informed the feudal lords saying 'We will execute Han's traitorous minister Chao Cuo to pacify the ancestral temples.'
translations.idiomatic: In King Xiao of Qi's eleventh year, King Pi of Wu and King Wu of Chu rebelled, raised troops west, and informed the feudal lords saying, 'We will execute Han's traitorous minister Chao Cuo to pacify the ancestral temples.'

sentences.zh: 膠西、膠東、菑川、濟南皆擅發兵應吳楚。

translations.literal: Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Zichuan, and Jinan all arbitrarily raised troops to respond to Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 欲與齊，齊孝王狐疑，城守不聽，三國兵共圍齊。

translations.literal: They wished to join with Qi, but King Xiao of Qi was doubtful, defended his cities and would not listen. The troops of the three states jointly besieged Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊王使路中大夫告於天子。

translations.literal: The King of Qi sent the Chamberlain for the Capital to report to the Son of Heaven.

sentences.zh: 天子復令路中大夫還告齊王：「善堅守，吾兵今破吳楚矣。」

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven again commanded the Chamberlain for the Capital to return and inform the King of Qi: 'Hold firm in your defense. My troops have now defeated Wu and Chu.'
translations.idiomatic: The Son of Heaven again commanded the Chamberlain for the Capital to return and inform the King of Qi, 'Hold firm in your defense. My troops have now defeated Wu and Chu.'

sentences.zh: 路中大夫至，三國兵圍臨菑數重，無從入。

translations.literal: The Chamberlain for the Capital arrived, but the three states' troops surrounded Linzi in multiple layers, and there was no way to enter.

sentences.zh: 三國將劫與路中大夫盟，曰：「若反言漢已破矣，齊趣下三國，不且見屠。」

translations.literal: The generals of the three states coerced the Chamberlain for the Capital into an alliance, saying: 'If you falsely claim Han has been defeated and Qi surrenders to the three states, we will not butcher them.'
translations.idiomatic: The generals of the three states coerced the Chamberlain for the Capital into an alliance, saying, 'If you falsely claim Han has been defeated and Qi surrenders to the three states, we will not butcher them.'

sentences.zh: 路中大夫既許之，至城下，望見齊王，曰：「漢已發兵百萬，使太尉周亞夫擊破吳楚，方引兵救齊，齊必堅守無下！」

translations.literal: The Chamberlain for the Capital having agreed to it, reached the city walls, caught sight of the King of Qi, and said: 'Han has already raised a million troops and sent Grand Marshal Zhou Yafu to defeat Wu and Chu. They are now leading troops to rescue Qi. Qi must hold firm and not surrender!'
translations.idiomatic: The Chamberlain for the Capital having agreed to it, reached the city walls, caught sight of the King of Qi, and said, 'Han has already raised a million troops and sent Grand Marshal Zhou Yafu to defeat Wu and Chu. They are now leading troops to rescue Qi. Qi must hold firm and not surrender!'

sentences.zh: 三國將誅路中大夫。

translations.literal: The generals of the three states executed the Chamberlain for the Capital.

In King Xiao of Qi year 11, King Wu Pi and King Chu Wu rebelled, raising troops west, informing the feudal lords: 'We will execute the Han traitor minister Chao Cuo to pacify the ancestral temples.' Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Zichuan, and Jinan all arbitrarily raised troops to respond to Wu and Chu. They wished to join with Qi, but King Xiao of Qi was hesitant, defended the city and would not listen, so the three states' troops jointly besieged Qi. The King of Qi sent the Road Middle Grandee to report to the Son of Heaven. The Son of Heaven again commanded the Road Middle Grandee to return and inform the King of Qi: 'Defend well, my troops have now defeated Wu and Chu.' The Road Middle Grandee arrived, but the three states' troops surrounded Linzi in several layers, with no way to enter. The three states' generals coerced the Road Middle Grandee into swearing an oath, saying: 'If you speak contrary to what we say and claim Han has been defeated, Qi will surrender to the three states, otherwise you will be slaughtered.' The Road Middle Grandee having agreed, reached the city wall and seeing the King of Qi, said: 'Han has already dispatched a million troops, commanding Grand Commandant Zhou Yafu to defeat Wu and Chu, and is now leading troops to rescue Qi—Qi must firmly defend and not surrender!' The three states' generals executed the Road Middle Grandee.

sentences.zh: 齊初圍急，陰與三國通謀，約未定，會聞路中大夫從漢來，喜，及其大臣乃復勸王毋下三國。

translations.literal: At first when the siege of Qi was urgent, they secretly conspired with the three states. The agreement was not yet finalized when they heard the Chamberlain for the Capital had come from Han. They were pleased, and together with the ministers again advised the king not to surrender to the three states.

sentences.zh: 居無何，漢將欒布、平陽侯等兵至齊，擊破三國兵，解齊圍。

translations.literal: Soon after, Han generals Luan Bu, Marquis Pingyang, and others led troops to Qi, defeated the three states' troops, and lifted the siege of Qi.

sentences.zh: 已而復聞齊初與三國有謀，將欲移兵伐齊。

translations.literal: Soon after they again heard that Qi had initially conspired with the three states, and wished to shift troops to attack Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊孝王懼，乃飲藥自殺。

translations.literal: King Xiao of Qi was afraid and took poison to commit suicide.

sentences.zh: 景帝聞之，以為齊首善，以迫劫有謀，非其罪也，乃立孝王太子壽為齊王，是為懿王，續齊後。

translations.literal: Emperor Jing heard of this and considered Qi to have been foremost in virtue. Though coerced into conspiracy, it was not their crime. He established King Xiao's heir Shou as King of Qi, who became King Yi, continuing Qi's line.

sentences.zh: 而膠西、膠東、濟南、菑川王咸誅滅，地入于漢。

translations.literal: The kings of Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Jinan, and Zichuan were all executed and their states abolished, their territories reverting to Han.

sentences.zh: 徙濟北王王菑川。

translations.literal: The King of Jibei was moved to rule Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 齊懿王立二十二年卒，子次景立，是為厲王。

translations.literal: King Yi of Qi reigned for twenty-two years and died. His son Ci Jing ascended the throne, becoming King Li.

At first when the siege was urgent, Qi secretly communicated with the three states, but the agreement was not yet set when they happened to hear the Road Middle Grandee coming from Han, rejoiced, and together with his ministers again advised the king not to surrender to the three states. Before long, Han generals Luan Bu and Marquis Pingyang and others' troops arrived at Qi, defeated the three states' troops, and lifted the siege of Qi. Soon after, they again heard that Qi had initially conspired with the three states, so they intended to shift troops to attack Qi. King Xiao of Qi feared this and drank poison to commit suicide. Emperor Jing heard of it and considered Qi foremost in loyalty, that being coerced into conspiracy was not his crime, so he established King Xiao's crown prince Shou as King of Qi, becoming King Yi, continuing the Qi line. The kings of Jiaoxi, Jiaodong, Jinan, and Zichuan were all executed and their states abolished, territories incorporated into Han. The King of Jibei was moved to rule Zichuan. King Yi of Qi reigned for twenty-two years and died, his son Ci Jing ascended, becoming King Li.

sentences.zh: 齊厲王，其母曰紀太后。

translations.literal: King Li of Qi—his mother was called Empress Dowager Ji.

sentences.zh: 太后取其弟紀氏女為厲王后。

translations.literal: The empress dowager took a daughter of her younger brother from the Ji clan as consort for King Li.

sentences.zh: 王不愛紀氏女。

translations.literal: The king did not love the Ji clan daughter.

sentences.zh: 太后欲其家重寵，令其長女紀翁主入王宮，正其後宮，毋令得近王，欲令愛紀氏女。

translations.literal: The empress dowager wished her family to be greatly favored, so she commanded her eldest daughter Princess Ji to enter the king's palace, to oversee his rear palace and not allow others to approach the king, wishing to make him love the Ji clan daughter.

sentences.zh: 王因與其姊翁主姦。

translations.literal: The king then committed adultery with his sister Princess Ji.

King Li of Qi's mother was called Empress Dowager Ji. The empress dowager took her younger brother Ji's daughter as consort for King Li. The king did not love the Ji clan daughter. The empress dowager desired her family's prestige to be honored, so she commanded her eldest daughter Princess Ji to enter the king's palace, to order the rear palace and not allow others to approach the king, desiring to make him love the Ji clan daughter. The king then committed adultery with his sister Princess Ji.

sentences.zh: 齊有宦者徐甲，入事漢皇太后。

translations.literal: Qi had a eunuch Xu Jia who entered to serve Han's Grand Empress Dowager.

sentences.zh: 皇太后有愛女曰修成君，修成君非劉氏，太后憐之。

translations.literal: The Grand Empress Dowager had a beloved daughter called Lady Xiucheng. Lady Xiucheng was not of the Liu clan, and the empress dowager pitied her.

sentences.zh: 修成君有女名娥，太后欲嫁之於諸侯，宦者甲乃請使齊，必令王上書請娥。

translations.literal: Lady Xiucheng had a daughter named E. The empress dowager wished to marry her to a feudal lord. The eunuch Jia requested to be sent to Qi, and would certainly make the king submit a memorial requesting E.

sentences.zh: 皇太后喜，使甲之齊。

translations.literal: The Grand Empress Dowager was pleased and sent Jia to Qi.

sentences.zh: 是時齊人主父偃知甲之使齊以取后事，亦因謂甲：「即事成，幸言偃女願得充王後宮。」

translations.literal: At this time, the man from Qi Zhu Fu Yan knew Jia was sent to Qi to take a consort, and thus told Jia: 'If the matter succeeds, please mention that Yan's daughter wishes to fill the king's rear palace.'
translations.idiomatic: At this time, the man from Qi Zhu Fu Yan knew Jia was sent to Qi to take a consort, and thus told Jia, 'If the matter succeeds, please mention that Yan's daughter wishes to fill the king's rear palace.'

sentences.zh: 甲既至齊，風以此事。

translations.literal: Jia having arrived in Qi, sounded out this matter.

sentences.zh: 紀太后大怒，曰：「王有后，後宮具備。

translations.literal: Empress Dowager Ji was greatly angered and said: 'The king has a consort, and the rear palace is fully equipped.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Dowager Ji was greatly angered and said, 'The king has a consort, and the rear palace is fully equipped.

sentences.zh: 且甲，齊貧人，急乃為宦者，入事漢，無補益，乃欲亂吾王家！

translations.literal: Moreover Jia is a poor man from Qi who in desperation became a eunuch and entered to serve Han. He provides no benefit and wishes to disrupt my royal family!'

sentences.zh: 且主父偃何為者？

translations.literal: 'And what sort of person is Zhu Fu Yan?

sentences.zh: 乃欲以女充後宮！」

translations.literal: He wishes to fill the rear palace with his daughter!'

sentences.zh: 徐甲大窮，還報皇太后曰：「王已願尚娥，然有一害，恐如燕王。」

translations.literal: Xu Jia was greatly distressed and returned to report to the Grand Empress Dowager: 'The king already wishes to take E as consort, but there is one harm—I fear it will be like the King of Yan.'
translations.idiomatic: Xu Jia was greatly distressed and returned to report to the Grand Empress Dowager, 'The king already wishes to take E as consort, but there is one harm—I fear it will be like the King of Yan.'

sentences.zh: 燕王者，與其子昆弟姦，新坐以死，亡國，故以燕感太后。

translations.literal: The King of Yan committed adultery with his sons and younger brothers, and recently was convicted and died, losing his state. Thus he used Yan to persuade the empress dowager.

sentences.zh: 太后曰：「無復言嫁女齊事。」

translations.literal: The empress dowager said: 'No more talk of marrying the daughter to Qi.'
translations.idiomatic: The empress dowager said, 'No more talk of marrying the daughter to Qi.'

sentences.zh: 事浸潯［不得］聞於天子。

translations.literal: The matter gradually leaked and came to the Son of Heaven's attention.

sentences.zh: 主父偃由此亦與齊有卻。

translations.literal: Zhu Fu Yan thus also had grievances with Qi.

Qi had a eunuch Xu Jia who entered to serve the Han Empress Dowager. The Empress Dowager had a beloved daughter called Lady Xiucheng, who was not of the Liu clan, and the Empress Dowager pitied her. Lady Xiucheng had a daughter named E, the Empress Dowager wished to marry her to a feudal lord, so eunuch Jia requested to be sent to Qi, and would certainly make the king submit a memorial requesting E. The Empress Dowager was pleased and sent Jia to Qi. At this time, the Qi man Zhu Fu Yan knew Jia was being sent to Qi for the consort matter, and also told Jia: 'If the matter succeeds, please mention that Yan's daughter wishes to fill the king's rear palace.' Jia having arrived in Qi, hinted at this matter. Empress Dowager Ji was greatly angered, saying: 'The king has a consort, the rear palace is complete. Moreover Jia is a poor man from Qi, in dire straits he became a eunuch and entered to serve Han, providing no benefit, yet desires to disrupt my king's household! Moreover who is Zhu Fu Yan? He also desires to have his daughter fill the rear palace!' Xu Jia was greatly embarrassed and returned to report to the Empress Dowager: 'The king already wishes to take E as consort, however there is one harm—I fear it will be like the King of Yan.' The King of Yan had committed incest with his sons and younger brothers, recently condemned to death and lost his state, thus using Yan to influence the Empress Dowager. The Empress Dowager said: 'No more talk of marrying a daughter to Qi.' The matter gradually leaked and was heard by the Son of Heaven. Zhu Fu Yan thereby also had resentment toward Qi.

sentences.zh: 主父偃方幸於天子，用事，因言：「齊臨菑十萬戶，市租千金，人眾殷富，巨於長安，此非天子親弟愛子不得王此。

translations.literal: Zhu Fu Yan was currently favored by the Son of Heaven and held power. He thus spoke: 'Qi's Linzi has a hundred thousand households, market rents of a thousand jin, the people are numerous and wealthy, greater than Chang'an. This is not a place for anyone but the Son of Heaven's own younger brother or beloved son to rule.
translations.idiomatic: Zhu Fu Yan was currently favored by the Son of Heaven and held power. He thus spoke, 'Qi's Linzi has a hundred thousand households, market rents of a thousand jin, the people are numerous and wealthy, greater than Chang'an. This is not a place for anyone but the Son of Heaven's own younger brother or beloved son to rule.

sentences.zh: 今齊王於親屬益疏。」

translations.literal: Now the King of Qi is increasingly distant in kinship.'

sentences.zh: 乃從容言：「呂太后時齊欲反，吳楚時孝王幾為亂。

translations.literal: He then leisurely spoke: 'During Empress Lü's time Qi wished to rebel. During the Wu and Chu time King Xiao nearly caused chaos.
translations.idiomatic: He then leisurely spoke, 'During Empress Lü's time Qi wished to rebel. During the Wu and Chu time King Xiao nearly caused chaos.

sentences.zh: 今聞齊王與其姊亂。」

translations.literal: Now I hear the King of Qi is committing incest with his sister.'

sentences.zh: 於是天子乃拜主父偃為齊相，且正其事。

translations.literal: Thus the Son of Heaven appointed Zhu Fu Yan as Qi chancellor, and moreover to investigate this matter.

sentences.zh: 主父偃既至齊，乃急治王後宮宦者為王通於姊翁主所者，令其辭證皆引王。

translations.literal: Zhu Fu Yan having arrived in Qi, urgently interrogated the eunuchs in the king's rear palace who arranged the king's liaisons with his sister Princess Ji, commanding their testimonies and evidence to all implicate the king.

sentences.zh: 王年少，懼大罪為吏所執誅，乃飲藥自殺。

translations.literal: The king was young and feared the great crime would lead to his arrest and execution by the officials, so he took poison and committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 絕無後。

translations.literal: The line was extinguished without descendants.

Zhu Fu Yan was then favored by the Son of Heaven and handled affairs, thus spoke: 'Qi Linzi has 100,000 households, market taxes of 1000 jin, the people are numerous and wealthy, greater than Chang'an—this is not for the Son of Heaven's close younger brother or beloved son to rule. Now the King of Qi in terms of kinship is increasingly distant.' He then casually spoke: 'During Lü Empress Dowager time Qi desired to rebel, during Wu and Chu time King Xiao nearly created disorder. Now I hear the King of Qi commits incest with his sister.' Thus the Son of Heaven appointed Zhu Fu Yan as Qi chancellor, and to investigate the matter. Zhu Fu Yan having arrived in Qi, urgently interrogated the eunuchs in the king's rear palace who had enabled the king's liaisons with his sister Princess Ji, commanding their confessions and testimony to all implicate the king. The king was young, feared great crime and being arrested and executed by officials, so drank poison to commit suicide. He had no descendants.

sentences.zh: 是時趙王懼主父偃一出廢齊，恐其漸疏骨肉，乃上書言偃受金及輕重之短。

translations.literal: At this time the King of Zhao feared that Zhu Fu Yan, having once deposed Qi, would gradually alienate the royal kin. He submitted a memorial speaking of Yan's receiving gold and his faults of weighing lightly and heavily.

sentences.zh: 天子亦既囚偃。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven also imprisoned Yan.

sentences.zh: 公孫弘言：「齊王以憂死毋後，國入漢，非誅偃無以塞天下之望。」

translations.literal: Gongsun Hong spoke: 'The King of Qi died of sorrow without descendants, the state reverted to Han. Not executing Yan will not satisfy the realm's expectations.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongsun Hong spoke, 'The King of Qi died of sorrow without descendants, the state reverted to Han. Not executing Yan will not satisfy the realm's expectations.'

sentences.zh: 遂誅偃。

translations.literal: Thus Yan was executed.

At this time, the King of Zhao feared that Zhu Fu Yan with one move had abolished Qi, and worried that this would gradually distance the flesh and blood relatives, so he submitted a memorial speaking of Yan receiving gold and his frivolous faults. The Son of Heaven had also already imprisoned Yan. Gongsun Hong said: 'The King of Qi died of worry without descendants, the state entered Han, without executing Yan there is no way to satisfy the expectations of the realm.' Thus Yan was executed.

sentences.zh: 齊厲王立五年死，毋後，國入于漢。

translations.literal: King Li of Qi reigned for five years and died without descendants. The state reverted to Han.
King Li of Qi reigned for five years and died without descendants, the state was incorporated into Han.

sentences.zh: 齊悼惠王後尚有二國，城陽及菑川。

translations.literal: King Daohui of Qi's descendants still had two states: Chengyang and Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 菑川地比齊。

translations.literal: Zichuan territory bordered Qi.

sentences.zh: 天子憐齊，為悼惠王冢園在郡，割臨菑東環悼惠王冢園邑盡以予菑川，以奉悼惠王祭祀。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven pitied Qi and, because King Daohui's tomb and garden were in the commandery, carved out the settlements east of Linzi encircling King Daohui's tomb and garden and gave them all to Zichuan to maintain King Daohui's sacrifices.

King Daohui of Qi's descendants still had two states remaining: Chengyang and Zichuan. Zichuan territory bordered Qi. The Son of Heaven pitied Qi, and because King Daohui's tomb garden was in the commandery, he carved off the towns east of Linzi encircling King Daohui's tomb garden and gave them all to Zichuan, to maintain King Daohui's sacrifices.

sentences.zh: 城陽景王章，齊悼惠王子，以朱虛侯與大臣共誅諸呂，而章身首先斬相國呂王產於未央宮。

translations.literal: King Jing of Chengyang Zhang, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Zhuxu together with the ministers commonly executed the various Lü, and Zhang himself was the first to behead Chancellor King Lü Chan in Weiyang Palace.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝既立，益封章二千戶，賜金千斤。

translations.literal: Emperor Wen having ascended, increased Zhang's enfeoffment by two thousand households and granted him a thousand jin of gold.

sentences.zh: 孝文二年，以齊之城陽郡立章為城陽王。

translations.literal: In Emperor Wen's second year, he used Qi's Chengyang commandery to establish Zhang as King of Chengyang.

sentences.zh: 立二年卒，子喜立，是為共王。

translations.literal: He reigned for two years and died. His son Xi ascended the throne, becoming King Gong.

Chengyang King Jing Zhang, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Zhuxu together with ministers commonly executed the various Lü, and Zhang personally was first to behead Chancellor King Lü Chan in Weiyang Palace. After Emperor Wen was established, he increased Zhang's fief by 2000 households and granted him 1000 jin of gold. In Emperor Wen year 2, using Qi's Chengyang commandery he established Zhang as King of Chengyang. He reigned for two years and died, his son Xi ascended, becoming King Gong.

sentences.zh: 共王八年，徙王淮南。

translations.literal: In King Gong's eighth year, he was moved to rule Huainan.

sentences.zh: 四年，復還王城陽。

translations.literal: After four years, he was returned to rule Chengyang.

sentences.zh: 凡三十三年卒，子［建］延立，是為頃王。

translations.literal: In total he reigned for thirty-three years and died. His son Jian Yan ascended the throne, becoming King Qing.
In King Gong year 8, he was moved to rule Huainan. Four years later, he returned to rule Chengyang. In all he reigned thirty-three years and died, his son [Jian] Yan ascended, becoming King Qing.

sentences.zh: 頃王二十（八）［六］年卒，子義立，是為敬王。

translations.literal: King Qing reigned for twenty-six years and died. His son Yi ascended the throne, becoming King Jing.

sentences.zh: 敬王九年卒，子武立，是為惠王。

translations.literal: King Jing reigned for nine years and died. His son Wu ascended the throne, becoming King Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠王十一年卒，子順立，是為荒王。

translations.literal: King Hui reigned for eleven years and died. His son Shun ascended the throne, becoming King Huang.

sentences.zh: 荒王四十六年卒，子恢立，是為戴王。

translations.literal: King Huang reigned for forty-six years and died. His son Hui ascended the throne, becoming King Dai.

sentences.zh: 戴王八年卒，子景立，至建始三年，十五歲，卒。

translations.literal: King Dai reigned for eight years and died. His son Jing ascended the throne. He reached the third year of Jianshi and died at fifteen years old.

King Qing reigned for twenty-[six] years and died, his son Yi ascended, becoming King Jing. King Jing reigned for nine years and died, his son Wu ascended, becoming King Hui. King Hui reigned for eleven years and died, his son Shun ascended, becoming King Huang. King Huang reigned for forty-six years and died, his son Hui ascended, becoming King Dai. King Dai reigned for eight years and died, his son Jing ascended, reaching Yuanshi year 3, fifteen years old, died.

sentences.zh: 濟北王興居，齊悼惠王子，以東牟侯助大臣誅諸呂，功少。

translations.literal: King Jibei Xingju, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Dongmu assisted the ministers in executing the various Lü, but his merit was small.

sentences.zh: 及文帝從代來，興居曰：「請與太仆嬰入清宮。」

translations.literal: When Emperor Wen came from Dai, Xingju said: 'Please let me enter the palace with Grand Coachman Ying.'
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Wen came from Dai, Xingju said, 'Please let me enter the palace with Grand Coachman Ying.'

sentences.zh: 廢少帝，共與大臣尊立孝文帝。

translations.literal: He deposed the young emperor and together with the ministers honored and established Emperor Wen.

Jibei King Xingju, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Dongmu assisted ministers in executing the various Lü, his merit was small. When Emperor Wen came from Dai, Xingju said: 'Please let me enter the Pure Palace with Grand Coachman Ying.' They deposed the Young Emperor and together with ministers honored and established Emperor Wen.

sentences.zh: 孝文帝二年，以齊之濟北郡立興居為濟北王，與城陽王俱立。

translations.literal: In Emperor Wen's second year, he used Qi's Jibei commandery to establish Xingju as King of Jibei, standing together with the King of Chengyang.

sentences.zh: 立二年，反。

translations.literal: He reigned for two years and rebelled.

sentences.zh: 始大臣誅呂氏時，朱虛侯功尤大，許盡以趙地王朱虛侯，盡以梁地王東牟侯。

translations.literal: At first when the ministers executed the Lü clan, Marquis Zhuxu's merit was especially great. It was promised to enfeoff Marquis Zhuxu with all Zhao territory, and to enfeoff Marquis Dongmu with all Liang territory.

sentences.zh: 及孝文帝立，聞朱虛、東牟之初欲立齊王，故絀其功。

translations.literal: When Emperor Wen ascended, he heard that Zhuxu and Dongmu had initially wished to establish the King of Qi, so he diminished their merit.

sentences.zh: 及二年，王諸子，乃割齊二郡以王章、興居。

translations.literal: By the second year when he enfeoffed the various sons, he carved out two Qi commanderies to enfeoff Zhang and Xingju.

sentences.zh: 章、興居自以失職奪功。

translations.literal: Zhang and Xingju considered themselves to have lost their positions and had their merit stolen.

sentences.zh: 章死，而興居聞匈奴大入漢，漢多發兵，使丞相灌嬰擊之，文帝親幸太原，以為天子自擊胡，遂發兵反於濟北。

translations.literal: Zhang died, but Xingju heard that the Xiongnu had greatly invaded Han, and Han had raised many troops, sending Chancellor Guan Ying to attack them. Emperor Wen personally went to Taiyuan, considering that the Son of Heaven himself was attacking the Hu, so Xingju raised troops and rebelled in Jibei.

sentences.zh: 天子聞之，罷丞相及行兵，皆歸長安。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven heard of this and dismissed the chancellor and the expeditionary troops, all returning to Chang'an.

sentences.zh: 使棘蒲侯柴將軍擊破虜濟北王，王自殺，地入于漢，為郡。

translations.literal: He sent Marquis Jipu Chai as general to attack and defeat, capturing the King of Jibei. The king committed suicide, and the territory reverted to Han, becoming a commandery.

In Emperor Wen year 2, using Qi's Jibei commandery he established Xingju as King of Jibei, established together with the King of Chengyang. He reigned for two years and rebelled. At first when ministers executed the Lü clan, Marquis Zhuxu's merit was especially great, they promised to enfeoff Marquis Zhuxu with all Zhao territory, enfeoff Marquis Dongmu with all Liang territory. When Emperor Wen was established, hearing that Zhuxu and Dongmu had initially wished to establish the King of Qi, thus he diminished their merit. By year 2 when enfeoffing the various sons, he carved off two Qi commanderies to enfeoff Zhang and Xingju. Zhang and Xingju considered themselves deprived of their offices and merit. Zhang died, while Xingju heard that the Xiongnu had greatly invaded Han, Han had dispatched many troops, commanding Chancellor Guan Ying to attack them, Emperor Wen personally proceeded to Taiyuan, considering it the Son of Heaven personally attacking the Hu, thus Xingju raised troops and rebelled in Jibei. The Son of Heaven heard of it, dismissed the chancellor and expeditionary troops, all returning to Chang'an. He sent General Chai Marquis Jipu to attack and defeat the King of Jibei, the king committed suicide, the territory was incorporated into Han as a commandery.

sentences.zh: 後十（二）［三］年，文帝十六年，復以齊悼惠王子安都侯志為濟北王。

translations.literal: Thirteen years later, in Emperor Wen's sixteenth year, he again established Andu Marquis Zhi, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as King of Jibei.

sentences.zh: 十一年，吳楚反時，志堅守，不與諸侯合謀。

translations.literal: Eleven years later, during the Wu and Chu rebellion, Zhi held firm in his defense and did not conspire with the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 吳楚已平，徙志王菑川。

translations.literal: After Wu and Chu were pacified, Zhi was moved to rule Zichuan.

Thirteen years later, in Emperor Wen year 16, again using King Daohui of Qi's son Marquis Andu Zhi as King of Jibei. Eleven years later, during the Wu and Chu rebellion, Zhi firmly defended and did not conspire with the feudal lords. After Wu and Chu were pacified, Zhi was moved to rule Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 濟南王辟光，齊悼惠王子，以勒侯孝文十六年為濟南王。

translations.literal: King Jinan Pi Guang, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Le Marquis in Emperor Wen's sixteenth year became King of Jinan.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與吳楚反。

translations.literal: Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 漢擊破，殺辟光，以濟南為郡，地入于漢。

translations.literal: Han attacked and defeated him, killing Pi Guang. Jinan was made a commandery, and the territory reverted to Han.

Jinan King Pi Guang, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Le in Emperor Wen year 16 became King of Jinan. Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu. Han attacked and defeated them, killed Pi Guang, made Jinan into a commandery, territory incorporated into Han.

sentences.zh: 菑川王賢，齊悼惠王子，以武城侯文帝十六年為菑川王。

translations.literal: King Zichuan Xian, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Wucheng Marquis in Emperor Wen's sixteenth year became King of Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與吳楚反，漢擊破，殺賢。

translations.literal: Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu. Han attacked and defeated him, killing Xian.

Zichuan King Xian, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Wucheng in Emperor Wen year 16 became King of Zichuan. Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu, Han attacked and defeated them, killed Xian.

sentences.zh: 天子因徙濟北王志王菑川。

translations.literal: The Son of Heaven thus moved King Jibei Zhi to rule Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 志亦齊悼惠王子，以安都侯王濟北。

translations.literal: Zhi was also a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Andu Marquis ruling Jibei.

sentences.zh: 菑川王反，毋後，乃徙濟北王王菑川。

translations.literal: The King of Zichuan rebelled and had no descendants, so the King of Jibei was moved to rule Zichuan.

sentences.zh: 凡立三十五年卒，謚為懿王。

translations.literal: In total he reigned for thirty-five years and died, receiving the posthumous title King Yi.

sentences.zh: 子建代立，是為靖王。

translations.literal: His son Jian succeeded him, becoming King Jing.

sentences.zh: 二十年卒，子遺代立，是為頃王。

translations.literal: He reigned for twenty years and died. His son Yi succeeded him, becoming King Qing.

sentences.zh: 三十六年卒，子終古立，是為思王。

translations.literal: He reigned for thirty-six years and died. His son Zhonggu succeeded him, becoming King Si.

sentences.zh: 二十八年卒，子尚立，是為孝王。

translations.literal: He reigned for twenty-eight years and died. His son Shang succeeded him, becoming King Xiao.

sentences.zh: 五年卒，子橫立，至建始三年，十一歲，卒。

translations.literal: He reigned for five years and died. His son Heng succeeded him. He reached the third year of Jianshi and died at eleven years old.

The Son of Heaven thus moved King Zhi of Jibei to rule Zichuan. Zhi was also a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Andu he ruled Jibei. The King of Zichuan rebelled without descendants, thus the King of Jibei was moved to rule Zichuan. In all he reigned thirty-five years and died, given the posthumous title King Yi. His son Jian succeeded him, becoming King Jing. He reigned twenty years and died, his son Yi succeeded him, becoming King Qing. He reigned thirty-six years and died, his son Zhong Gu succeeded him, becoming King Si. He reigned twenty-eight years and died, his son Shang succeeded him, becoming King Xiao. He reigned five years and died, his son Heng succeeded him, reaching Yuanshi year 3, eleven years old, died.

sentences.zh: 膠西王卬，齊悼惠王子，以昌平侯文帝十六年為膠西王。

translations.literal: King Jiaoxi Ang, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Changping Marquis in Emperor Wen's sixteenth year became King of Jiaoxi.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與吳楚反。

translations.literal: Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu.

sentences.zh: 漢擊破，殺卬，地入于漢，為膠西郡。

translations.literal: Han attacked and defeated him, killing Ang. The territory reverted to Han, becoming Jiaoxi commandery.

Jiaoxi King Ang, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Changping in Emperor Wen year 16 became King of Jiaoxi. Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu. Han attacked and defeated them, killed Ang, the territory was incorporated into Han as Jiaoxi commandery.

sentences.zh: 膠東王雄渠，齊悼惠王子，以白石侯文帝十六年為膠東王。

translations.literal: King Jiaodong Xiong Qu, a son of King Daohui of Qi, as Baishi Marquis in Emperor Wen's sixteenth year became King of Jiaodong.

sentences.zh: 十一年，與吳楚反，漢擊破，殺雄渠，地入于漢，為膠東郡。

translations.literal: Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu. Han attacked and defeated him, killing Xiong Qu. The territory reverted to Han, becoming Jiaodong commandery.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：諸侯大國無過齊悼惠王。

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: Among the feudal lords' great states, none exceeded King Daohui of Qi.

sentences.zh: 以海內初定，子弟少，激秦之無尺土封，故大封同姓，以填萬民之心。

translations.literal: Because the realm had only recently been pacified, sons and younger brothers were few, reacting against Qin's policy of not granting even an inch of land in fiefs, he greatly enfeoffed same surnames to fill the hearts of the ten thousand people.

sentences.zh: 及後分裂，固其理也。

translations.literal: When later it split apart, this was indeed the natural principle.

Jiaodong King Xiong Qu, son of King Daohui of Qi, as Marquis Baishi in Emperor Wen year 16 became King of Jiaodong. Eleven years later, he rebelled with Wu and Chu, Han attacked and defeated them, killed Xiong Qu, the territory was incorporated into Han as Jiaodong commandery. The Grand Historian says: Among the feudal lords' great states, none exceeded King Daohui of Qi. Because the realm had just been pacified, sons and younger brothers were few, provoked by Qin's policy of not granting even a foot of land in fief, thus he greatly enfeoffed same surnames to fill the hearts of the ten thousand people. When later it was divided, it was certainly the natural principle.
